summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the in-person pretrial conference for the Ghislaine Maxwell case scheduled for November 1, 2021. It details the location, COVID-19 protocols, and arrangements for public and victim access via overflow courtrooms with video feeds.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this pretrial conference is being scheduled.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, scheduling the pretrial conference and outlining the procedural and safety protocols.

events.title: In-person pretrial conference
events.description: A scheduled in-person pretrial conference for the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: A pretrial conference for Ghislaine Maxwell's case was scheduled for November 1, 2021, at 11:00 a.m.
The conference was to be held in person in Courtroom 518, with public access provided via live video/audio feeds in designated overflow courtrooms due to COVID-19 protocols.
The order explicitly states the court will ensure access for alleged victims and members of the defendant's family.
Strict COVID-19 protocols were in place, including a health questionnaire, temperature checks, and mandatory mask-wearing for all courthouse visitors.
